{
    "name": "Tomimatsu-Sato Metric",
    "abbrev": "tomimatsuSato",
    "description": "The Tomimatsu-Sato metric is a spherically symmetric solution to Einstein's field equations, describing a rotating black hole. It was proposed as a simplified model of a rotating black hole, providing a more realistic representation than the Kerr metric.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": 0,
    "dimensions": 4,

    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "TomimatsuSato",
            "xlineElement": "-dt^2 + (1-2GM/r)(dx^2 + dy^2) + (r^2+r^2\*dt^2/GM^2) * (dtheta^2 + (r^2\*sin(theta)^2) * dphi^2)",
            "validated": false
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"]
}[0m
